Land of the rising sun..

Japan has always been high on my bucketlist, and this year I was lucky enough to venture over and explore for two weeks! We stuck mainly to the beaten track, in terms of cities, with a sprinkling of nature when we stayed by the base of Mount Fuji. Japan has a lot to offer, so is a perfect place for foodies, nature lovers or those who love busy bustling city with vast nightlife. Within cities, particularly Tokyo, the juxtaposition between the old and new is vast, where ancient temples are surrounded by modern bulidings and new technology (futuristic vibes). It is by far one of my favourite places to visit, globally, and will be heading back out there in the near future to explore the breathtaking landscapes.

Kawaguchiko

Kawaguchiko is a town located near the base of Mount Fuji, and accessible from Tokyo via bus or train. We opted to visit this, as we didn't want to miss seeing the beautiful volcano (almost did due to the clouds) and it was a nice escape from the Tokyo
